messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Meeting others in South Carolina

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/9/2002 11:32:14 AM Eastern Standard Time,
zenmomma@... writes:
> I too would vote for just hanging out rather than sightseeing. Better to get
>
> to know people that way.

How about a picnic at the zoo or the lake? I might be able to wrangle a boat
even. At the OTHER lake, my brother-in-law has a house and a boat---that's
sounding even better. (Now I'll have to suck-up!). Or we can just hang here.

Kelly

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Meeting others in South Carolina
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ahhh, here you go. :o) I ve been planning to fly in for the conference alone (without kids that is). Now maybe I ll have Conor come with me. I m not sure
messages.messageBody:
>>Marty's planning to go with me. He's 13 and wants to go to the gaming
>>shop there in Columbia. If anyone has a kid with a similar interest, that
>>would be great! >>


Ahhh, here you go. :o) I've been planning to fly in for the conference alone
(without kids that is). Now maybe I'll have Conor come with me. I'm not sure
how well that would go over with Casey, though.

I too would vote for just hanging out rather than sightseeing. Better to get
to know people that way.

~Mary

messages.subject: Meeting others in South Carolina
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/9/02 8:44:27 AM, kbcdlovejo@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/9/02 8:44:27 AM, kbcdlovejo@... writes:

<< Monday's a holiday. We can certainly plan something else for afterwards if
anyone's interested. >>

I'd rather hang around with other homeschoolers than go sightseeing (IF I've
gotten to see some stuff Friday, and I hear that there are things within
walking distance of the hotel).

Marty's planning to go with me. He's 13 and wants to go to the gaming shop
there in Columbia. If anyone has a kid with a similar interest, that would
be great! Since his main hangout is a gaming shop and he's only been to
three or four different ones, he wants to see more what the range is, and
maybe play against some new people.

Sandra
